column1: 2 ^ In te
column3: sperávi
column4: non confùndar in aĕtèrnum~; in justìția tua líbera me. ^ In thee
column7: let me never be confounded~; deliver me in thy justice.

column1: 3 ^ Inclína ad me aŭrem tuam~; accèlera ut éruas me. Esto mìchi in Deum protectórem
column3: ut salvum me fáçias
column4: ^ Bow down thy ear to me~; make haste to deliver me. Be thou unto me a protector God

column1: 4 ^ qŭóniam fortitúdo mea et refúģium meum es tu
column2: et pròpter nomen tuum dedúces me et enútries me. ^ for thou art my strength and my refuge
column3: and for thy name's sake thou wilt lead me and nourish me.

column1: 5 ^ Edúces me de láqŭeo hoc qŭem absconduérunt mìchi
column2: qŭóniam tu es protéctor meus. ^ Thou wilt bring me out of this snare which they have hidden for me
column3: for thou art my protector.

column1: 6 ^ In manûs tuas commèndo spíritum meum~; redemìsti me
column3: Deus veritátis. ^ Into thy hands I commend my spirit~; thou hast redeemed me

column1: 7 ^ Odìsti observántes vanitátes supervácue~; ego aŭtem in Dòmino sperávi. ^ Thou hast hated them that regard vanities to no purpose~; but I have hoped in the Lord.
8 ^ Exsultábo
column3: qŭóniam respexìsti humilitátem meam~; salvavìsti de necessitátibus ánimam meam. ^ I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy
column4: for thou hast regarded my humility~; thou hast saved my soul out of distresses.

column1: 9 ^ Nec conclusìsti me in mánibus inimíci~; statuvìsti in loco spațióso pèdes meos. ^ And thou hast not shut me up in the hands of the enemy~; thou hast set my feet in a spacious place.
10 ^ Miserére mei
column3: qŭóniam trìbulor~; conturbátus est in ira òculus meus
column5: et vènter meus. ^ Have mercy on me
column7: for I am afflicted~; my eye is troubled with wrath

column1: 11 ^ Qŭóniam defécit in dolóre vita mea
column2: et anni mei in ģemìtibus. infirmáta est in paŭpertáte vìrtûs mea
column3: et òssua mea conturbáta sunt. ^ For my life is wasted with grief
column4: and my years in sighs. My strength is weakened through poverty and my bones are disturbed.

column1: 12 ^ Super òmnes inimícos meos factus sum oppróbrium
column3: et tìmor notîs meîs. Qŭi vedébant me foras fuģivérunt a me. ^ I am become a reproach among all my enemies
column4: and very much to my neighbours
column5: and a fear to my acquaintances. They that saw me without fled from me.

column1: 13 ^ Oblivióni datus sum
column2: tamqŭam mórtuus a corde~; factus sum tamqŭam vas pèrditum
column3: ^ I am given to forgetfulness
column4: as one dead from the heart. I am become as a vessel that is destroyed.

column1: 14 ^ qŭóniam aŭdívi vituperațiónem multórum commorántium in circùmitu. In eo dum convenírent sìmul advèrsum me
column2: accìpere ánimam meam consiliáti sunt. ^ for I have heard the blame of many that dwell round about. While they assembled together against me
column3: they consulted to take away my life.

column1: 15 ^ Ego aŭtem in te sperávi
column3: «~Deus meus es tu.~»^ But I have put my trust in thee

column1: 16 ^ In mánibus tuîs sortes meaĕ~; éripe me de manu inimicórum meórum
column2: et a perseqŭèntibus me. ^ My lots are in thy hands~; deliver me out of the hands of my enemies
column3: and from them that persecute me.

column1: 17 ^ Illústra fáçiem tuam super servum tuum~; salvum me fac in misericórdia tua. ^ Make thy face to shine upon thy servant~; save me in thy mercy.
18 ^ Dòmine
column3: qŭóniam invocávi te. Erubéscant ìmpii
column4: et deducántur in infèrnum. ^ O Lord
column6: for I have called upon thee. Let the wicked be ashamed
column7: and be brought down to hell.

column1: 19 ^ Muta fiant lábia dolósa
column2: qŭaĕ loqŭùntur advèrsus justum iniqŭitátem in supèrbia et in abusióne. ^ Let deceitful lips be made dumb
column3: which speak iniquity against the just with pride and with abuse.

column1: 20 ^ Quam magna multitúdo dulcédinis tuaĕ
column3: qŭam absconduìsti timèntibus te~; perfecìsti eîs qŭi sperant in te
column4: in conspèctu filiórum hòminum. ^ O how great is the multitude of thy sweetness
column6: which thou hast hidden for them that fear thee~; thou hast wrought for them that hope in thee
column7: in the sight of the sons of men.

column1: 21 ^ Abscòndes eos in abscòndito fașiéi tuaĕ a conturbațióne hòminum~; próteģes eos in tabernáculo tuo a contradicțióne lingŭárum. ^ Thou shalt hide them in the secret of thy face from the disturbance of men~; thou shalt protect them in thy tabernacle from the contradiction of tongues.
22 ^ Benedìctus Dòminus
column2: qŭóniam mirificávit misericórdiam suam mìchi in civitáte muníta. ^ Blessed be the Lord
column3: for he hath shown his wonderful mercy to me in a fortified city.

column1: 23 ^ Ego aŭtem dixi in excèssu mentis meaĕ
column2: «~Projèctus sum a fáçie oculórum tuórum.~» Ìdeo exaŭdivìsti vocem orațiónis meaĕ
column3: dum clamárem ad te. ^ But I said in the excess of my mind
column4: "I am cast away from before thy eyes." Therefore thou hast heard the voice of my prayer

column1: 24 ^ Dilìģite Dòminum
column3: qŭóniam veritátem reqŭíret Dòminus
column4: et retrìbuet abundánter facièntibus supèrbiam. ^ O love the Lord
column6: for the Lord will require truth
column7: and will repay them abundantly that act proudly.

column1: 25 ^ Viríliter áģite
column3: òmnes qŭi sperátis in Dòmino. ^ Do ye manfully
column4: and let your heart be strengthened
column5: all ye that hope in the Lord.
